title: Celebrity haunt San Carlo puts rise in profits on the menu
text:

Sun, Jul 5, 2015, 22:41 BST - UK Markets closed Celebrity haunt San Carlo puts rise in profits on the menu By Ashley Armstrong | Telegraph – 2 hours 25 minutes ago 707.68 -1.82 
Restaurant group (LSE: RTN.L - news ) targets overseas expansion to capitalise on China's growing love of Italian food 
San Carlo, the Italian restaurant group which has attracted celebrity diners including pop star Rihanna and footballer Cristiano Ronaldo, has increased its sales by 12.5pc as it targets a roll-out overseas. 
The Northern leisure business has reported a rise in turnover to £46.2m last year while pre-tax profits grew to £2.1m from £1.9m the year before. 
The upmarket restaurant chain is predicting sales to rise to £55m this year after opening new sites in London’s Covent Garden and a Fumo cocktail bar in Manchester. 
San Carlo is also pushing its brand overseas and has already secured sites in Qatar and Bahrain as well as plans to open in Istanbul and China. China’s growing middle class is increasingly fond of European food which led to Italian restaurant chain Pizza Express being sold to China’s Hony Capital last year for £900m. 
“It’s been another busy year for the group, and the success of our newer brands is evident in the excellent growth figures that we are witnessing at present”, said Marcello Distefano, managing director at San Carlo. 
“We’re focused on maintaining this momentum, and are looking to offer our innovative concepts to new and exciting markets.” 
San Carlo founder Carlo Distefano and his son Marcello 
San Carlo also has a tie-up with Italian-born celebrity chef Aldo Zilli who has created a range of dishes for San Carlo’s Cicchetti restaurants. 
The business continues to be family run by Sicilian-born Carlo Distefano, 71, and his son Marcello, who started the business in 2004. 
The success of San Carlo is a tale of entrepreneurial success after Distefano arrived in Britain in 1962 aged 17 with just £12 loaned to him by his brother and a job at a barbershop. He set up his first restaurant 30 years later.
